articles.description: Listen to 5 Live commentary and follow live text updates as Liverpool host Brighton and Man City face Arsenal in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Liverpool host Brighton in huge day in title race

articles.description: Watch live coverage and follow text commentary as Ireland host Italy at the RDS Arena, Dublin in the Women's Six Nations.
articles.title: Women's Six Nations: Italy beat Ireland - as it happened

articles.description: Liverpool move top of the Premier League - for a couple of hours at least - as Mohamed Salah ends Brighton's resistance to secure a vital victory at Anfield.
articles.title: Salah scores winner as Liverpool move top

articles.description: England scored eight tries to hammer Wales at Ashton Gate on Saturday. Is the depth in their squad proving the difference?
articles.title: England have strength to play 'three different games'

articles.description: Watch live BBC Two coverage and follow commentary and text updates as Arsenal take on Chelsea in the Women's League Cup final at Molineux.
articles.title: Watch Women's League Cup final: Arsenal 0-0 Chelsea

articles.description: Mexico's Gilberto Ramirez beats France's Armenia-born world champion Arsen Goulamirian to win the WBA (Super) cruiserweight title.
articles.title: Gilberto Ramirez beats Arsen Goulamirian to win WBA (Super) cruiserweight title

articles.description: Celtic return to top spot in the Premiership as they sink bottom club Livingston with three goals in a strong second-half showing.
articles.title: Celtic back on top after beating Livingston

articles.description: Tom Roebuck scores a hat-trick as Sale beat Exeter 41-5 to move back into the Premiership play-off mix.
articles.title: Roebuck scores hat-trick as Sale crush Exeter

articles.description: Newcastle captain Jamaal Lascelles needs surgery on a knee injury and is expected to be out for "six to nine months".
articles.title: Lascelles out for six to nine months with knee injury

articles.description: Dutch rider Mathieu van der Poel wins the Tour of Flanders - one of road cycling's five Monuments - for a record-equalling third time.
articles.title: Tour of Flanders: Mathieu van der Poel wins for record-equalling third time
